text: We find delight in the beauty and happiness of children that makes the heart too big for the body.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: It is cruel, you know, that music should be so beautiful. It has the beauty of loneliness of pain: of strength and freedom. The beauty of disappointment and never-satisfied love. The cruel beauty of nature and everlasting beauty of monotony.
author: Benjamin Britten

text: Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul.
author: John Muir

text: Beauty is an outward gift, which is seldom despised, except by those to whom it has been refused.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: As we grow old, the beauty steals inward.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
